name: Sheraton Crystal City Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at this property while visiting a friend in DC. The property was reasonably priced, is right across the street from a metro stop, and is surrounded by other hotels/food options/shopping. Because of my status in Starwood's program I received a comp upgrade to a club floor room. Because this was a weekend this included a complementary breakfast buffet in the downstairs bistro, which was substantial (eggs, bacon, potatoes, rolls, pastries, etc.) and filling.
reviews.title: Good hotel with some flaws

likes.liked: — Convenient to metro, good room rate

reviews.title: Mostly great
reviews.text: My biggest concern with the property was that my non-smoking room had the lingering smell of having been a smoking room. I also had no functioning ice machine on my floor (the 14th). When I tried the 15th and 12th floors, neither of those ice machines were functional either. When I called the front desk to inquire which floor had a working ice machine, I was told not to worry, that room service would bring a bucket of ice to my room. In my estimation this was an appropriate response to a broken ice machine . Unfortunately, room service never arrived with my ice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at this property were at one of two extremes, either friendly and helpful or disinterested with an "I can't be bothered" type attitude. Since the property was very lightly booked during my stay I would have expected service to be very prompt and attentive. I sometimes got that and sometimes did not.
reviews.title: Very Nice Staff

reviews.text: Overall I wasn't turned off enough to swear off this property for good, but I wasn't impressed enough to not seek out other options next time I'm in the area.
reviews.title: Good renovations

reviews.text: For the price this is an INCREDIBLE place. We paid $95/night, AAA rate, booked on the Sheraton site. The other sites (Travelocity, Expedia, Orbitz, etc.) were not much more. Our room (on the Starwood Preferred Guest floor) was spacious -- two double beds (and room to squeeze a rollaway cot between them), a desk, stuffed chair and side table. We had a small refrigerator, and a complimentary bottle of water was brought every day. We were VERY disappointed that the pool "wasn't working" after Labor Day -- I think they just don't staff it or something.
reviews.title: Renovated Sheraton is an improvement

description: Sheraton Crystal City Hotel is located one mile from the Ronald Reagan National airport and next to the Crystal City Metro Station. 16,000 square feet of flexible meeting space.
